title: Shocking video shows prisoner being beaten in Essex prison
text:
Horrifying footage shows a prisoner screaming in horror as his fellow inmates repeatedly hit him in a terrifying attack.

The clip is believed to have been taken inside a prison in Essex and shows a male inmate being repeatedly hit in the face.

He whimpers: 'What did I do, what did I do cuz? as he tries to protect his head from being struck with his arms.

One of the men in the cell threatens: 'Say sorry now,' prompting an immediate apology from the victim - only for him to be hit again.

The Ministry of Justice have said the acts will 'never be tolerated' and they are cracking down on illegal phones being smuggled into prison.

The clip is believed to have been taken inside a prison in Essex and shows a male inmate being repeatedly hit in the face as he cowers in the corner of the room

The victim whimpers: 'What did I do, what did I do cuz? as he tries to protect his head from being struck with his arms (pictured)

The video then cuts to a close-up of the beaten prisoner's bloodied face, when he is told to say: 'I s*** c*** for money' as a light is shone in his eyes.

The gang around him responds: 'You s*** c*** for money innit, you f***ing p*****'.

The beaten prisoner then yells out: 'Ow my legs!' Just as something is thrown at him.

Another prisoner then shouts: 'Shut the f*** up about your legs you little p****!'

The man continues to yell in pain as the other prisoner beat him.

The video was circulated widely on social media, with dozens deeply shocked by the disturbing footage.

The video then cuts to a close-up of the beaten prisoner's bloodied face, when he is told to say: 'I s*** c*** for money' as a light is shone in his eyes

One person said: 'This is utterly unacceptable. Prison is deterrent not torture.'

Another wrote: 'This is f****** awful to watch, report it and delete it - please.'

On Facebook someone else commented: 'All little jailhouse wannabe gangsters.'

Someone else condemned the clip, saying: 'All of them are Cowards. And thick because they got caught.'

The Ministry of Justice today said they will not tolerate such behaviour.

A Prison Service spokesman: 'This behaviour will never be tolerate and is one of the reasons why we are spending an extra £100 million on cutting-edge technology to detect and block mobile phones and crack down on those who are violent in prison.'
